info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:19AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Steuben, Allen, northern Blackford, De Kalb, Wells, Adams, northern Jay, Branch, Hillsdale, Defiance, western Fulton, Paulding, Van Wert and Williams Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 818 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Union City to 7 miles southwest of Angola to near Fort Wayne to near Van Buren. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... New Haven and Waterloo around 825 AM EDT. Butler and Hamilton around 830 AM EDT. Monroeville and Pennville around 835 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Edgerton, Payne, Edon, Bryan, Portland, Montpelier, Jonesville, Litchfield, Geneva, Convoy and Holiday City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 4 and 6, and between mile markers 9 and 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 313 and 357. Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 137 and 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
